revised_title: Petrified Bones, Estuaries, and the Evolution of Coastal Landscapes
tldr: The author discusses the discovery of large petrified bones in a gravel pit near Harwich, Essex, and compares them to similar findings in Kent. They also explore the history of estuaries and coastal landscapes, including the impact of tides and geological changes over time. The author suggests that these findings can help determine the depth and shape of these areas in the past.
